page.title: 05LOCAL NEWS.
page.content: The 'Buckingham Advertiser' was founded in 1853. It distributes 10 000 copies weekly,circulating in Bucks, Oxon and Northants. Now rivalled by free editions of the 'Mirror' and 'Citizen',it places more emphasis on advertisements than stories. Typical stories cover local events such as weddings,fetes and church parades. The main issues on the 12th July were: Major cuts of 2 675 000 in education spending,and the need for the county to save a total of 3 595 000. The death of a local stunt entertainer. The rescue of a bather at Buckingham swimming pool. A dangerous local road. Other stories reported on fund-raising and local societies e.g. the Young Farmers, also on school events.
